stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the session rebuilding a sub-area of Course 2 (Divine Dino Domain), replacing an unpopular autoscroller with new platforming while wearing a hat to hide a haircut mishap. He discusses overall progress, future levels, technical glitches, and YouTube marketing.

development_findings.summary: The old leaf-boat autoscroll in Course 2 was scrapped and replaced with a ‘platforming playground’ featuring moving platforms, vines, stair exits from water, hanging rides, and a Yoshi-god statue.
development_findings.quote: I realized the section sucked, so now we have a little bit of a platforming playground here.

development_findings.summary: Overall project completion is a bit above 80 %; only three courses (13–15) remain once Course 12 assets are slotted in.
development_findings.quote: How much percent finished… just above 80. We're getting there.

development_findings.summary: Tentative level plan: Course 13 – suspenseful ice castle, Course 14 – space arcade (partly built in secret), Course 15 – still undecided.
development_findings.quote: We know that course 13 is going to be probably an ice castle… course 14 is going to be a space arcade… I'm undecided on course 15 right now.

development_findings.summary: Course 12 is ‘mostly’ done; awaiting a few Zeina animations and sign text before shipping.
development_findings.quote: I finished Course 12 off-stream… there's a few more animations from Zeina I have to put in the game, but then Course 12 is all good to be shipped.

development_findings.summary: Serious loading-time and water-physics bugs plague Divine Dino Domain; outdated water step code can crash the game.
development_findings.quote: Water hasn't been updated to the new step function yet… being in water can just crash the game.

development_findings.summary: Kaze changed Biobak’s Chain Chomp code so he could spawn a second Chomp in another level.
development_findings.quote: I changed your Chain Chomp code just like a week or two ago… because I wanted a second Chain Chomp in a different level.

development_findings.summary: Design pipeline: block-out geometry first, verify fun movement, then handle UVs and aesthetics.
development_findings.quote: Right now we just want the platforming to be fun and then after we have the platforming, we're gonna work on the aesthetic.

development_findings.summary: Uses Fast64 (Blender addon) and decomp build; all areas are currently kept in memory, losing RAM compared to legacy ROMManager method.
development_findings.quote: There used to be a tool called ROMManager… but that is made for binary, so we can't use it with decomp… it means we lose a lot of RAM.

development_findings.summary: A forthcoming SimpleFlips-competition hack targets 60 fps on real N64 and carries a deliberately long comedic title.
development_findings.quote: I am releasing a new mod soon that will run really well on N64… most of the game is 60 fps on N64.

development_findings.summary: YouTube marketing tweak: low CTR video retitled to “64 bits. Nintendo’s biggest lie” to boost engagement.
development_findings.quote: YouTube is all about the angle.

context_findings.summary: Zeina accidentally shaved a bald stripe in Kaze’s hair; he streams under a beanie and jokes about monetising the reveal.
context_findings.quote: There's just the fucking bald line here.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s YouTube channel brings in roughly $450 per month; he avoids Patreon bonuses to reduce Nintendo legal exposure.
context_findings.quote: My first YouTube channel… income this month was around $450… I also don't give out any Patreon bonuses because that might get me in legal trouble with Nintendo.

context_findings.summary: Expecting a child this year, which may prevent hosting the annual F3 hacking event.
context_findings.quote: I don't know if I can host F3 this year because I'm gonna have a child coming out around the same time.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy: values fast iteration and fun gameplay over visuals, and embraces sensational titles as a marketing necessity.
General mistrust of cloud services (OneDrive) and barbers; prefers self-reliance.

biobak.summary: Kaze refactored Biobak’s Chain Chomp code to support multiple instances and invited him back to write more code.
biobak.quote: I changed your Chain Chomp code just like a week or two ago.

biobak.summary: Biobak complained about Blender’s snapping behaviour during level design discussion.

zeina.summary: Provided additional animations needed to finalise Course 12.
zeina.quote: There's a few more animations from Zeina I have to put in the game.

zeina.summary: Responsible for the haircut mishap; lent Kaze the beanie he wears on stream.
zeina.quote: Basically, Zaina slipped with the hair clippers and just put a bald spot there.

key_stories.title: Haircut Accident
key_stories.summary: Zeina attempted to cut Kaze’s hair, accidentally removing the clipper guard and carving a bald stripe. Kaze hides it with a hat and turns the mishap into stream entertainment.
key_stories.challenge: Cover a botched haircut before going live.
key_stories.process: Wore a beanie, teased viewers with incremental reveals, offered incentives.
key_stories.outcome: Comic moment, potential monetisation, insight into personal dynamics.
key_stories.key_quote: There's just the fucking bald line here.

key_stories.title: Course 2 Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Kaze replaces a disliked autoscrolling raft section in Course 2 with engaging platforming, vines, stair exits, and a Yoshi statue.
key_stories.process: Blocked out new geometry in Blender, tested movement, planned aesthetics for later.
key_stories.outcome: New layout close to completion pending UVs and visuals.
key_stories.key_quote: I realized the section sucked, so now we have a little bit of a platforming playground here.

key_stories.title: Adding a Second Chain Chomp
key_stories.summary: Need for multiple Chain Chomps led Kaze to rewrite Biobak’s original code.
key_stories.challenge: Existing script only supported one instance.
key_stories.process: Refactored and expanded the behaviour code.
key_stories.outcome: Feature working; Kaze publicly asks Biobak to rejoin development.
key_stories.key_quote: I changed your Chain Chomp code just like a week or two ago.

key_stories.title: YouTube CTR Rescue
key_stories.summary: A new clip underperformed, so Kaze changed the title to a sensational claim to test click-through rate improvement.
key_stories.process: Renamed video to “64 bits. Nintendo’s biggest lie.” and monitored analytics.
key_stories.outcome: Early signs of CTR rise; illustrates marketing mindset.
key_stories.key_quote: That's a good title. That is gonna make such a big difference.
